GOD.content: there’s always a Letter to the Father before the event (avant la lettre), signed by a son who publishes posthumously [Kafka, Johannes de Silentio]

R.content: [re: Greek word democracy] heirs, legatees, the legacy & the allegation (play btwn legare & legere), “sending or putting off (renvoi) gestures toward the past of an inheritance only by remaining to come,” for democracy

POO.content: we are indebted to Kant, his heirs, to the great philosopher of critique

FWT.content: Derrida recognizes in himself the figure of an heir, in a deliberate, often happy way
heir must respond to double injunction: reaffirm what comes “before us,” necessary (il faut) to appropriate a past fundamentally inappropriable, reaffirm, relaunch otherwise, keep alive
reaffirmation which continues & interrupts: one’s own decision as that of the other: signature against signature
“I have always forbidden myself to injure or put to death” [avoid putting to death by reaffirming heritage] [don’t let dead bury the dead]

contradictory/uncomfortable double injunction: mad for absolute past, past whose (im)measure that of bottomless memory, while dreading nostalgia, fixation, cult of remembrance: nothing seems desirable save in this injunction > leave life in life & make it live again [this “heir]
heritage not only a double injunction or reaffirmation but a choice, filtering, heir not only receives but is one who risks choosing

POOF.content: friendship can never elude rhetoric of epitáphios, transfixed celebration of spectrality, at once fervent & caught in petrified cold of its inscription (funeral speech, testamentary fervor of heir)

MONL.content: Derrida dreams of leaving marks that recall the entirely other prior-to-the-first language: degree zero-minus-one of memory, a desire for infinite salvation: scratch and graft, caress with claws, borrowed [see DEBT] claws

TB.content: for Benjamin, translator as survivor, agent of sur-vival, heir [man], the sur-vival of translation can make original text not only live longer but more & better

WAP.content: Hegel “took out insurance” on his Heirs (on the State, on the University)
Hegel’s complex strategy for a post-Hegelian era (did he think of anything else?)

PIO.content: does the child (son) invent himself specularly though parent’s narcissism > or is he an absolute invention (this being the truest response to parent’s desire): where truth is thought beyond any inheritance?

LI.content: Searle as only rightful son to commit parricide (a logic found in Sophist); Searle’s indebted/mortgaged signature > auto-authorized descendant
[Derrida feels some guilt for impeding this procedure of inheritance]

CF.content: we are all heir to crimes against humanity, i.e. the revolutions that made this concept [human rights] possible

OG.content: [vis-à-vis Lévi-Strauss] birth of writing (in colloquial sense) most often linked to genealogical anxiety > genealogical relation & social classification as stitched steam (point de suture) [point de capiton?] of arche-writing: condition of (so-called oral) language and possibility of writing in colloquial sense

ATAP.content: every apocalyptic eschatology promised in name of light, we are heirs to these Lumières, cannot & must not forgo the Aufklärung; must keep enough apocalyptic desire (clarity, revelation) to deconstruct apocalyptic discourse

SPEC.content: Freud: “super-ego is the heir of the Oedipus complex and represents the ethical standards of mankind”
